You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Unit tests for read and write handles for image transfer. """ import mock from openstack.common import test from openstack.common.vmware import exceptions from openstack.common.vmware import rw_handles from openstack.common.vmware import vim_util class FileHandleTest(test.BaseTestCase): """Tests for FileHandle.""" def test_close(self): file_handle = mock.Mock() vmw_http_file = rw_handles.FileHandle(file_handle) vmw_http_file.close() file_handle.close.assert_called_once_with() def test_del(self): file_handle = mock.Mock() vmw_http_file = rw_handles.FileHandle(file_handle) del(vmw_http_file) file_handle.close.assert_called_once_with() def test_find_vmdk_url(self): device_url_0 = mock.Mock() device_url_0.disk = False device_url_1 = mock.Mock() device_url_1.disk = True device_url_1.url = 'https://*/ds1/vm1.vmdk' lease_info = mock.Mock() lease_info.deviceUrl = [device_url_0, device_url_1] host = '10.1.2.3' exp_url = 'https://%s/ds1/vm1.vmdk' % host vmw_http_file = rw_handles.FileHandle(None) self.assertEqual(exp_url, vmw_http_file._find_vmdk_url(lease_info, host)) class FileWriteHandleTest(test.BaseTestCase): """Tests for FileWriteHandle.""" def setUp(self): super(FileWriteHandleTest, self).setUp() vim_cookie = mock.Mock() vim_cookie.name = 'name' vim_cookie.value = 'value' self._conn = mock.Mock() patcher = mock.patch('httplib.HTTPConnection') self.addCleanup(patcher.stop) HTTPConnectionMock = patcher.start() HTTPConnectionMock.return_value = self._conn self.vmw_http_write_file = rw_handles.FileWriteHandle( '10.1.2.3', 'dc-0', 'ds-0', [vim_cookie], '1.vmdk', 100, 'http') def test_write(self): self.vmw_http_write_file.write(None) self._conn.send.assert_called_once_with(None) def test_close(self): self.vmw_http_write_file.close() self._conn.getresponse.assert_called_once_with() self._conn.close.assert_called_once_with() class VmdkWriteHandleTest(test.BaseTestCase): """Tests for VmdkWriteHandle.""" def setUp(self): super(VmdkWriteHandleTest, self).setUp() self._conn = mock.Mock() patcher = mock.patch('httplib.HTTPConnection') self.addCleanup(patcher.stop) HTTPConnectionMock = patcher.start() HTTPConnectionMock.return_value = self._conn def _create_mock_session(self, disk=True, progress=-1): device_url = mock.Mock() device_url.disk = disk device_url.url = 'http://*/ds/disk1.vmdk' lease_info = mock.Mock() lease_info.deviceUrl = [device_url] session = mock.Mock() def session_invoke_api_side_effect(module, method, *args, **kwargs): if module == session.vim: if method == 'ImportVApp': return mock.Mock() elif method == 'HttpNfcLeaseProgress': self.assertEqual(progress, kwargs['percent']) return return lease_info session.invoke_api.side_effect = session_invoke_api_side_effect vim_cookie = mock.Mock() vim_cookie.name = 'name' vim_cookie.value = 'value' session.vim.client.options.transport.cookiejar = [vim_cookie] return session def test_init_failure(self): session = self._create_mock_session(False) self.assertRaises(exceptions.VimException, lambda: rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'rp-1', 'folder-1', None, 100)) def test_write(self): session = self._create_mock_session() handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'rp-1', 'folder-1', None, 100) data = [1] * 10 handle.write(data) self.assertEqual(len(data), handle._bytes_written) self._conn.send.assert_called_once_with(data) def test_update_progress(self): vmdk_size = 100 data_size = 10 session = self._create_mock_session(True, 10) handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'rp-1', 'folder-1', None, vmdk_size) handle.write([1] * data_size) handle.update_progress() def test_update_progress_with_error(self): session = self._create_mock_session(True, 10) handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'rp-1', 'folder-1', None, 100) session.invoke_api.side_effect = exceptions.VimException(None) self.assertRaises(exceptions.VimException, handle.update_progress) def test_close(self): session = self._create_mock_session() handle = rw_handles.VmdkWriteHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'rp-1', 'folder-1', None, 100) def session_invoke_api_side_effect(module, method, *args, **kwargs): if module == vim_util and method == 'get_object_property': return 'ready' self.assertEqual(session.vim, module) self.assertEqual('HttpNfcLeaseComplete', method) session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=session_invoke_api_side_effect) handle.close() self.assertEqual(2, session.invoke_api.call_count) class VmdkReadHandleTest(test.BaseTestCase): """Tests for VmdkReadHandle.""" def setUp(self): super(VmdkReadHandleTest, self).setUp() req_patcher = mock.patch('urllib2.Request') self.addCleanup(req_patcher.stop) RequestMock = req_patcher.start() RequestMock.return_value = mock.Mock() urlopen_patcher = mock.patch('urllib2.urlopen') self.addCleanup(urlopen_patcher.stop) urlopen_mock = urlopen_patcher.start() self._conn = mock.Mock() urlopen_mock.return_value = self._conn def _create_mock_session(self, disk=True, progress=-1): device_url = mock.Mock() device_url.disk = disk device_url.url = 'http://*/ds/disk1.vmdk' lease_info = mock.Mock() lease_info.deviceUrl = [device_url] session = mock.Mock() def session_invoke_api_side_effect(module, method, *args, **kwargs): if module == session.vim: if method == 'ExportVm': return mock.Mock() elif method == 'HttpNfcLeaseProgress': self.assertEqual(progress, kwargs['percent']) return return lease_info session.invoke_api.side_effect = session_invoke_api_side_effect vim_cookie = mock.Mock() vim_cookie.name = 'name' vim_cookie.value = 'value' session.vim.client.options.transport.cookiejar = [vim_cookie] return session def test_init_failure(self): session = self._create_mock_session(False) self.assertRaises(exceptions.VimException, lambda: rw_handles.VmdkReadHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'vm-1', '[ds] disk1.vmdk', 100)) def test_read(self): chunk_size = rw_handles.READ_CHUNKSIZE session = self._create_mock_session() self._conn.read.return_value = [1] * chunk_size handle = rw_handles.VmdkReadHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'vm-1', '[ds] disk1.vmdk', chunk_size * 10) handle.read(chunk_size) self.assertEqual(chunk_size, handle._bytes_read) self._conn.read.assert_called_once_with(chunk_size) def test_update_progress(self): chunk_size = rw_handles.READ_CHUNKSIZE vmdk_size = chunk_size * 10 session = self._create_mock_session(True, 10) self._conn.read.return_value = [1] * chunk_size handle = rw_handles.VmdkReadHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'vm-1', '[ds] disk1.vmdk', vmdk_size) handle.read(chunk_size) handle.update_progress() def test_update_progress_with_error(self): session = self._create_mock_session(True, 10) handle = rw_handles.VmdkReadHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'vm-1', '[ds] disk1.vmdk', 100) session.invoke_api.side_effect = exceptions.VimException(None) self.assertRaises(exceptions.VimException, handle.update_progress) def test_close(self): session = self._create_mock_session() handle = rw_handles.VmdkReadHandle(session, '10.1.2.3', 'vm-1', '[ds] disk1.vmdk', 100) def session_invoke_api_side_effect(module, method, *args, **kwargs): if module == vim_util and method == 'get_object_property': return 'ready' self.assertEqual(session.vim, module) self.assertEqual('HttpNfcLeaseComplete', method) session.invoke_api = mock.Mock( side_effect=session_invoke_api_side_effect) handle.close() self.assertEqual(2, session.invoke_api.call_count) class ImageReadHandleTest(test.BaseTestCase): """Tests for ImageReadHandle.""" def test_read(self): max_items = 10 item = [1] * 10 class ImageReadIterator: def __init__(self): self.num_items = 0 def __iter__(self): return self def next(self): if (self.num_items < max_items): self.num_items += 1 return item raise StopIteration handle = rw_handles.ImageReadHandle(ImageReadIterator()) for _ in range(0, max_items): self.assertEqual(item, handle.read(10)) self.assertFalse(handle.read(10))

commit_message:
Move utility methods in VMware drivers to OSLO

There is lot of common code between VMware drivers for nova and cinder;
for e.g., session management and VIM API invocation code. The new
VMware driver for glance and the telemetry agent for vSphere are also
planning to use this common code. This change moves the utility methods
for inventory traversal spec creation, managed object property retrieval
etc. defined in various drivers into OSLO.

Change-Id: I7cb79186028e405462b92a6ba2e37298d5ca0f9b
Implements: blueprint vmware-api

commit_message:
PCI reqeust support pci-flavor specs

The pci_passthrough:pci-flavor scope in flavor extra_specs
describes the pci-flavor name, the key is 'pci_passthrough:pci-flavor'
and the value has format:
  'count1:<pci-flavor-name1>, <name2>; count2:<pci-flavor-name2>'.

The flavor's requirement in instance type extra_specs is translated
to pci requests list used to schedule and allocation device.

requests spec compare to the pci_stats, all infomation in the stats
is flat dict, all (k,v) pair is treated as basic spec.

bp:pci-extra-info

Sined-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

Change-Id: I50de411a6b7519f4ea309cb56fab9c8f11807ffe

commit_message:
Make floating_ips module use FloatingIP for all get queries

This makes the network.floating_ips module use the FloatingIP
object for all get_* queries instead of direct database access.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I862f2f3abc078b477bea6bf86d0d622c4e78881f

commit_message:
Fix rsyslog templates for Openstack logs

- use *_matched values for facilities in templates
- simplify stop processing condition

Closes-bug: #1263675

Change-Id: Ia87861605f3182d4fef7dece7942beb207e7582a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/30/74030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <%= @syslog_log_facility_glance_matched %>.* -/var/log/glance-all.log & ~& ~

commit_message:
Remove using of deprecated self.headers (part2)

Attr self.headers in rest client is deprecated now, and
should be removed from usage by service clients.

This patch removes second bunch of attrs in service clients
and from rest client itself.

part1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73869/

Change-Id: I109479299cd41848e78700484bed862012638c4d
Partially-implements: bp refactor-rest-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/74090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp, body = self.get(url) resp, body = self.get(url)
deleted_lines: resp, body = self.get(url, self.headers) resp, body = self.get(url, self.headers)

commit_message:
Add basic Savanna CLI tests

It contains basic, read-only tests for Savanna CLI client. Checks return values
and output of read-only commands. It tests the following commands:

* this-does-not-exist
* plugin-list
* plugin-show
* node-group-template-list
* cluster-template-list
* cluster-list

Checks return values and output of read-only commands. These tests do not presume any content, nor do they create their own. They only verify the structure of output if present. """ def test_savanna_fake_action(self): self.assertRaises(subprocess.CalledProcessError, self.savanna, 'this-does-not-exist') def test_savanna_plugins_list(self): plugins = self.parser.listing(self.savanna('plugins-list')) self.assertTableStruct(plugins, ['name', 'versions', 'title']) def test_savanna_plugins_show(self): plugin = self.parser.listing(self.savanna('plugins-show', params='--name vanilla')) self.assertTableStruct(plugin, ['Property', 'Value']) def test_savanna_node_group_template_list(self): plugins = self.parser.listing(self.savanna('node-group-template-list')) self.assertTableStruct(plugins, ['name', 'id', 'plugin_name', 'node_processes', 'description']) def test_savanna_cluster_template_list(self): plugins = self.parser.listing(self.savanna('cluster-template-list')) self.assertTableStruct(plugins, ['name', 'id', 'plugin_name', 'node_groups', 'description']) def test_savanna_cluster_list(self): plugins = self.parser.listing(self.savanna('cluster-list')) self.assertTableStruct(plugins, ['name', 'id', 'status', 'node_count'])

subject: Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-13 15:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/8bb7830a5068000ca265493a93883b90114ccde7', 'message': "Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

(cherry picked from commit 472c1440677440e0888570926b49542ddf260724)

Conflicts:
	heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

cherry pick, including original commit message below from
oslo-incubator commit:

b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Closes bug: 1275838

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

(cherry picked from commit 472c1440677440e0888570926b49542ddf260724)

Conflicts:
	heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py

Change-Id: Id8a1c0665468b503b092c4f01ffd40e2be9c6fa9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/14/73314/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add new group related function to assignment API for federation

Implements: blueprint saml-id
Change-Id: I91094ad631e81f06bbc807674ed59ebc54e25250
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/45/73845/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.openstack.common import log LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) def _project_ids_to_dicts(self, session, ids): return [self._get_project(session, project_id).to_dict() for project_id in ids] #NOTE(marek-denis): This function is useful in the outer scope, so was # move to the class level. # Suggested refactoring so self._project_ids_to_dicts() is used # and removal of the local equivalent. def list_projects_for_groups(self, group_ids): """List all projects accessible for a member of specified groups :param group_ids: list of groups :type: list return: list of dictionarized projects """ project_ids = [] session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): for group_id in group_ids: q = session.query(GroupProjectGrant) q = q.filter_by(group_id=group_id) project_ids.extend([getattr(x, 'project_id') for x in q]) return self._project_ids_to_dicts(session, project_ids) def list_domains_for_groups(self, group_ids): """List all domains accessible for a member of specified groups :param group_ids: list of groups :type: list :returns: list of dictionarized domains """ domain_ids = [] session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): for group_id in group_ids: q = session.query(GroupDomainGrant) q = q.filter_by(group_id=group_id) domain_ids.extend([getattr(x, 'domain_id') for x in q]) return self._domain_ids_to_dicts(session, domain_ids) def get_roles_for_groups_and_project(self, group_ids, project_id): role_ids = [] session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): for group_id in group_ids: try: data = self._get_metadata(tenant_id=project_id, group_id=group_id, session=session) except exception.MetadataNotFound: LOG.debug("Didn't find matching role for group: %s" % group_id) continue roles = data.get('roles', {}) role_ids.extend(self._roles_from_role_dicts(roles, False)) return [self._get_role(session, role_id) for role_id in role_ids] def get_roles_for_groups_and_domain(self, group_ids, domain_id): role_ids = [] session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): for group_id in group_ids: try: data = self._get_metadata(domain_id=domain_id, group_id=group_id, session=session) except exception.MetadataNotFound: LOG.debug("Didn't find matching role for group: %s" % group_id) continue roles = data.get('roles', {}) role_ids.extend(self._roles_from_role_dicts(roles, False)) return [self._get_role(session, role_id) for role_id in role_ids] def get_roles_for_groups(self, group_ids, session=None): """Fetch a set of role ids assigned to the specified groups.""" def _fetch_roles_from_groups(cls, session): roles = [] for group_id in group_ids: query = session.query(cls) query = query.filter_by(group_id=group_id) grants_for_group = query.all() roles += [grant for grant in grants_for_group] return roles if session is None: session = db_session.get_session() with session.begin(): assignment_list = [] refs = _fetch_roles_from_groups(GroupDomainGrant, session) for x in refs: roles = x.data.get('roles', {}) for role in self._roles_from_role_dicts(roles, False): assignment_list.append(role) for role in self._roles_from_role_dicts(roles, True): assignment_list.append(role) refs = _fetch_roles_from_groups(GroupProjectGrant, session) for x in refs: roles = x.data.get('roles', {}) for role in self._roles_from_role_dicts(roles, False): assignment_list.append(role) return list(set(assignment_list)) def _domain_ids_to_dicts(self, session, ids): return [self._get_domain(session, domain_id).to_dict() for domain_id in ids]

added_lines: conflicts happen with installed files (e.g. a change from `foo/bar.py` to `foo/bar/__init__.py`). For best results, uninstall the old product1. Extraction of flags names: $ openstack-doc-tools/autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py create nova -i /repos/nova You only need to use the `create` action to add a new product. Otherwise, use `update`: $ openstack-doc-tools/autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py update nova -i /repos/nova The `create` action will create a new `nova.flagmappings` file, possibly overriding an existing file. The `update` action will create a `nova.flagmappings.new` file, merging in group information from the existing `nova.flagmappings` file. 2. Grouping of flags This is currently done manually, by using the flag name file and placing a category after a space: $ head nova.flagmappings aggregate\_image\_properties\_isolation\_namespace scheduling aggregate\_image\_properties\_isolation\_separator scheduling allow\_instance\_snapshots policy allow\_migrate\_to\_same\_host policy allow\_resize\_to\_same\_host policy allow\_same\_net\_traffic network allowed\_direct\_url\_schemes glance ... 3. Creation of docbook-formatted configuration table files: Example: $ openstack-doc-tools/autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py docbook nova -i /repos/nova Update automatically generated tables - from scratch: $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install git python-pip python-dev $ sudo pip install git-review GitPython $ git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-manuals.git $ git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools.git $ cd openstack-manuals/ $ git review -d 35726 $ cd tools/autogenerate-config-flagmappings Now, cloning and installing requirements for nova, glance, neutron: $ for i in nova glance neutron; do git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/$i.git; done $ for i in nova glance neutron; do sudo pip install -r $i/requirements.txt; done $ sudo pip install python-glanceclient websockify pyasn1 python-cinderclient error\_util $ sudo apt-get install python-ldap python-lxml Update the flag names: $ ../../../openstack-doc-tools/autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py -vvv update nova -i ~/nova > nova.loglabelled Unknown and fix it. Once that is done use: $ ../../../openstack-doc-tools/autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py -vvv docbook nova -i ~/novathe git repo.

commit_message:
Improve robustness with localbuilding

shutil.move will fail if the target already exists, thus delete
the target file if it exists.

Also, add a bit more debug output.

Change-Id: Ie58dfe1806e0aedf60c07bc7e7c8bbb44a948fee

Improve cli output

Implement some suggestions from Summer (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/73476)
and enhance.

Fix parsing of options, shown in output of "cinder --metadata".

commit_message:
Add a test for aggregate

Create and delete aggregate,
when the availability zone is number.

Change-Id: Ic062720ac62385f686f3d6140b908ff5859c8fbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/33/64233/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_aggregate_create_delete_with_number_az(self): # Create and delete an aggregate when az name is number. aggregate_name = data_utils.rand_name(self.aggregate_name_prefix) az_name = data_utils.rand_int_id(start=1000) resp, aggregate = self.client.create_aggregate(aggregate_name, az_name) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(aggregate_name, aggregate['name']) self.assertEqual(az_name, aggregate['availability_zone']) resp, _ = self.client.delete_aggregate(aggregate['id']) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.client.wait_for_resource_deletion(aggregate['id']) @attr(type='gate')

commit_message:
Only call decode() on bytes

In Python 3, text strings are not bytes, so the decode() method should not be
called on them.

Change-Id: I081c6a93daa86586378a15d8ae98738c41bda8d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/23/74123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use the '+' operation dict_items()

This operation is undefined in Python3, list() must be called first.

Change-Id: I764ee994b5faf0e6783e4025466e6ceb17fe3642

commit_message:
Restructure KDS options to be more like Keystone's options

Restructure the KDS options to be more closely aligned with the way
Keystone options work and allowing movement towards not registering
the options on import. This will also prevent KDS options from
appearing in the Keystone auto-generated sample config.

Change-Id: I073aa58ff3132e2714478f54c88c3a8200ff47da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/82/73882/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FILE_OPTIONS = { None: [ cfg.StrOpt('bind_ip', default='0.0.0.0', help='IP for the server to bind to'), cfg.IntOpt('port', default=9109, help='The port for the server')]} def configure(conf=None): if conf is None: conf = CONF for group in FILE_OPTIONS: conf.register_opts(FILE_OPTIONS[group], group=group) configure()
deleted_lines: API_SERVICE_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('bind_ip', default='0.0.0.0', help='IP for the server to bind to'), cfg.IntOpt('port', default=9109, help='The port for the server'), ] CONF.register_opts(API_SERVICE_OPTS)

subject: Refactor resource loading functions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-07 20:52:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/38dce52a8822bdb31f4afc1944428b2a9290e0a2', 'message': 'Refactor resource loading __init__

Change-Id: Iabd3da70f7ba35e0b43a2409e170be7f41a351a6
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-07 20:57:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/151dd6080bfe13b128714d30aaa1d38eac017759', 'message': 'Refactor resource loading __init__

Change-Id: Iabd3da70f7ba35e0b43a2409e170be7f41a351a6
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-07 22:46:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/aedbd451aaa5c26aea9ccdf019f82eb64cc75f81', 'message': "Refactor resource loading functions

All logic related to resource loading is currently put into
resource_mapping functions in each resource module and it doesn't return
the mapping information if the dependencies for a given resources are
not satisfied.

This refactors the way resources are loaded, so that the mapping
information is always available and if the dependencies are not met,
another function can be used to convey that information to heat:
available_resources().  To keep backwards compatibility, if
available_resources() is not callable for a given resource module, the
previous resource_mapping() will be used instead.

This allows the mapping information to be used in other places, such as
tests (without the need to hard code the mapping information when
registering the resource for the tests) or doc generation (to allow the
resources to be loaded even without their dependencies).

Related-Bug: #1271226
Change-Id: Iabd3da70f7ba35e0b43a2409e170be7f41a351a6

All logic related to resource loading is currently put into
resource_mapping functions in each resource module and it doesn't
return the mapping information if the dependencies for a given
resources are not satisfied.

This refactors the way resources are loaded, so that the mapping
information is always available and if the dependencies are not met,
another function can be used to convey that information to heat:
available_resource_mapping().  To keep backwards compatibility, if
available_resource_mapping() is not callable for a given resource
module, the previous resource_mapping() will be used instead.

This allows the mapping information to be used in other places, such
as tests (without the need to hard code the mapping information when
registering the resource for the tests) or doc generation (to allow
the resources to be loaded even without their dependencies).

commit_message:
Refactor resource loading functions

All logic related to resource loading is currently put into
resource_mapping functions in each resource module and it doesn't
return the mapping information if the dependencies for a given
resources are not satisfied.

This refactors the way resources are loaded, so that the mapping
information is always available and if the dependencies are not met,
another function can be used to convey that information to heat:
available_resource_mapping().  To keep backwards compatibility, if
available_resource_mapping() is not callable for a given resource
module, the previous resource_mapping() will be used instead.

This allows the mapping information to be used in other places, such
as tests (without the need to hard code the mapping information when
registering the resource for the tests) or doc generation (to allow
the resources to be loaded even without their dependencies).

Related-Bug: #1271226
Change-Id: Iabd3da70f7ba35e0b43a2409e170be7f41a351a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/89/71989/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_all_module_resources(module): return module.get_resources().iteritems() except Exception: LOG.info(_('Failed to list resources from %s') % str(module)) else: return {} def _get_available_module_resources(module): try: if callable(getattr(module, 'available_resources', None)): return module.available_resources().iteritems() elif callable(getattr(module, 'resource_mapping', None)): return module.resource_mapping().iteritems() except Exception: LOG.error(_('Failed to load resources from %s') % str(module)) return {} resource_lists = (_get_available_module_resources(m) for m in modules)def _global_modules(): return { 'core': plugin_loader.load_modules(sys.modules[__name__]), 'plugins': plugin_loader.load_modules(plugin_pkg, True), } def _load_global_resources(env): modules = _global_modules() _register_modules(env, modules['core']) _register_modules(env, modules['plugins'])
deleted_lines: def _get_module_resources(module): return module.resource_mapping().iteritems() except Exception: LOG.error(_('Failed to load resources from %s') % str(module)) else: return [] resource_lists = (_get_module_resources(m) for m in modules)def _load_global_resources(env): # load plugin modules _register_modules(env, plugin_loader.load_modules(sys.modules[__name__])) _register_modules(env, plugin_loader.load_modules(plugin_pkg, True))

commit_message:
Support building wheels (PEP-427)

Universal is used to identify pure-Python module(by bdist_wheel). For
these, it is sufficient to build a wheel with _any_ Python ABI version
and publish that to PyPI (by whatever means).

Change-Id: I807ae63a6faeb0e3fc0483c54e51bb3b14548f13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/33/57133/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [wheel] universal = 1

subject: Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-05 21:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/c37d9d993e6142581f6412c6e1f60f8a1009ac54', 'message': "Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

Closes-bug: #1276510

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

cherry pick, including original commit message from oslo-incubator commit:
b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Change-Id: I1fe0752d057789a944e416428f9c35c51c9f7d34
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise MySQL 2013 'Lost connection' errors

Closes-bug: #1276510

Although this code error is part of the `ping_listener` tests, it was
missing from the list of known - and ignored - connection errors.

The code error 2013 refers to a connection lost during a query, see:
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/error-messages-client.html#error_cr_server_lost

Without this error code, the session won't try to reconnect to mysql,
which makes `max_retries` useless.

cherry pick, including original commit message from oslo-incubator commit:
b4f72b2987d53bb434e3a833f06d70a2167f5efc

Change-Id: I1fe0752d057789a944e416428f9c35c51c9f7d34
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/91/71391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update Available Resources From Driver Stats

Enable the resource tracker to report available resources
from stats reported by the driver and not the audit process.
This functionality can be enabled by setting the nova.conf
variable; override_resource_audit to True.

Implement bp: use-driver-usage-stats
DocImpact: Added a new variable to nova.conf

Change-Id: Ia5ba3ea1180b209415d338b7b0ca6e21b0002b94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/66508/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('direct_available_resource_update', default=False, help='Override available resource audit and instead' 'update available resources from driver reported stats'), resources_copy = resources.copy() if CONF.direct_available_resource_update: resources['memory_mb_used'] = resources_copy['memory_mb_used'] + CONF.reserved_host_memory_mb resources['local_gb_used'] = resources_copy['local_gb_used'] + CONF.reserved_host_disk_mb resources['vcpus_used'] = resources_copy['vcpus_used']

commit_message:
Use the next built-in instead of next method

Starting in Python 2.6, `next` became a built-in function as a backport
from Python 3. This change switches several uses of the old `next()`
method on iterables, favoring the built-in function usage.

Change-Id: Ica0452eb90f1841be8678fa13cd9ebd8e4a4d8ff

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions

commit_message:
python3: Fix import compatibility.

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions
to different modules. Six provides a consistent interface
to them through the fake six.moves module.

However, the urllib, httplib, and etc modules have been combined
into one module which Six does not support so do it the old
fashioned way.

Change-Id: I366b198ff007a0c1b1aa52b41a95fa14a42a1153
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Drop nose, switching to testtools and testr

OpenStack as a whole is either in the process of, or currently making
use of testrepository and testtools as its base test infrastructure, and
so to that end bring Swift into line by switching away from nose to
testrepository. This drops nose from the test requirements, and switches
those that were making use of its imports to testtools.

Partial-Bug: 1179009
DocImpact: SAIO instructions now reference different packages to
install.

Change-Id: Ie4e17fded443a7ca1b96b9bba293f110418c2fc5

commit_message:
python3: Add python3 compatibility support

Add python2/python3 compatibility support:

- Use six.iteritems() to replace dictionary.iteritems()
on python2 or dictionary.items() on python3.

- Use next() to replace it.next()

Change-Id: I911afc7655df5807e39d141e6d87415255b4d2fa
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Adding check for django 1.5+

This adds a check for the django version. If it's 1.5, we need
to have an "ALLOWED_HOSTS=[hostname.example.com]" directive in
local_settings.py - This is a security enhancement

Closes-Bug: #1278030
Change-Id: I6dd0032447f08c982cfd16f562552141ad347b1d

commit_message:
Six: bump to 1.5.2

In order to ensure Python 3 compatibility of the OpenStack Python clients, we
need more advanced features of six that are not included in six 1.4.1. For
instance, six.moves.xmlrpc_client only landed in six in the 1.4.2 release. Just
bump to the latest release, so that we have as many features as we can dream
of.

Change-Id: I148a9736d8271575647bfd0963771a177f8b6c1e

commit_message:
Make floating_ip_bulk_destroy deallocate quota if not auto_assigned

The expected use case for floating_ip_bulk_destroy is to destroy
auto_assigned floating IPs, for which no quota is used so no quota
needs to be recovered.  But it can also be used to destroy other
(not auto_assigned) floating IPs, in which case the previously used
quota was not recovered.  This fixes the quota leak in that unusual
case.

Closes-Bug: #1254174

Change-Id: Ibff80d9ebac8d4422e401909033da12d9ec0b593
(cherry picked from commit 384cce84fde784f9e2f39db49502c66e20ff0b4c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/72549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import quota project_id_to_quota_count = collections.defaultdict(int) for ip_block in _ip_range_splitter(ips): # Find any floating IPs that were not auto_assigned and # thus need quota released. query = model_query(context, models.FloatingIp).\ filter(models.FloatingIp.address.in_(ip_block)).\ filter_by(auto_assigned=False) rows = query.all() for row in rows: # The count is negative since we release quota by # reserving negative quota. project_id_to_quota_count[row['project_id']] -= 1 # Delete the floating IPs. # Delete the quotas, if needed. for project_id, count in project_id_to_quota_count.iteritems(): try: reservations = quota.QUOTAS.reserve(context, project_id=project_id, floating_ips=count) quota.QUOTAS.commit(context, reservations, project_id=project_id) except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Failed to update usages bulk " "deallocating floating IP")) raise

subject: Fix a race condition in agents status update code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-24 14:58:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6698b363bbb6c74a5a25e6eccdb5b105015dbbbe', 'message': "Fix a race condition in agents status update code

Code handling agents status updates coming via RPC checks,
if a corresponding entry for the given (agent_type, host)
pair already exists in DB and updates it. And if it doesn't
exist, a new entry is created.

Without a unique constraint this can cause a race condition
resulting in adding of two agent entries having the same value
of (agent_type, host) pair.

Note, that it's already not allowed to have multiple agents of
the same type having the same host value, but currently it's
enforced only at code level, not at DB schema level, which
effectively makes race conditions possible.

Closes-Bug: #1254246

commit_message:
Fix a race condition in agents status update code

This consists of the following two Patches:

    Fix a race condition in agents status update code

    Code handling agents status updates coming via RPC checks,
    if a corresponding entry for the given (agent_type, host)
    pair already exists in DB and updates it. And if it doesn't
    exist, a new entry is created.

    Without a unique constraint this can cause a race condition
    resulting in adding of two agent entries having the same value
    of (agent_type, host) pair.

    Note, that it's already not allowed to have multiple agents of
    the same type having the same host value, but currently it's
    enforced only at code level, not at DB schema level, which
    effectively makes race conditions possible.

    (cherry picked from commit 5529071bf1393d0d448bc495cc906a68bc30a820)

and:

    Fix the migration adding a UC to agents table

    The migration script mistakenly assumes that all core
    plugins use agents extension, which is not true (e.g.
    plumgrid and bigswitch don't).

    Apply this migration script only for plugins that are
    stated in the original migration script adding agents
    table (511471cc46b_agent_ext_model_supp.py).

    (cherry picked from commit 8b67ee3d94a4866fd4ecd27e8fc37d2f17595aa9)

Change-Id: I1ebaa111154b3d6b34074705b579097ab730594c
Closes-Bug: #1254246

WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from neutron import context from neutron.db import agents_db from neutron.db import api as db from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 as base_plugin from neutron.openstack.common.db import exception as exc from neutron.tests import base class FakePlugin(base_plugin.NeutronDbPluginV2, agents_db.AgentDbMixin): """A fake plugin class containing all DB methods.""" class TestAgentsDbMixin(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestAgentsDbMixin, self).setUp() self.context = context.get_admin_context() self.plugin = FakePlugin() self.addCleanup(db.clear_db) self.agent_status = { 'agent_type': 'Open vSwitch agent', 'binary': 'neutron-openvswitch-agent', 'host': 'overcloud-notcompute', 'topic': 'N/A' } def _assert_ref_fields_are_equal(self, reference, result): """Compare (key, value) pairs of a reference dict with the result Note: the result MAY have additional keys """ for field, value in reference.items(): self.assertEqual(value, result[field], field) def test_create_or_update_agent_new_entry(self): self.plugin.create_or_update_agent(self.context, self.agent_status) agent = self.plugin.get_agents(self.context)[0] self._assert_ref_fields_are_equal(self.agent_status, agent) def test_create_or_update_agent_existing_entry(self): self.plugin.create_or_update_agent(self.context, self.agent_status) self.plugin.create_or_update_agent(self.context, self.agent_status) self.plugin.create_or_update_agent(self.context, self.agent_status) agents = self.plugin.get_agents(self.context) self.assertEqual(len(agents), 1) agent = agents[0] self._assert_ref_fields_are_equal(self.agent_status, agent) def test_create_or_update_agent_concurrent_insert(self): # NOTE(rpodolyaka): emulate violation of the unique constraint caused # by a concurrent insert. Ensure we make another # attempt on fail with mock.patch('sqlalchemy.orm.Session.add') as add_mock: add_mock.side_effect = [ exc.DBDuplicateEntry(columns=['agent_type', 'host']), None ] self.plugin.create_or_update_agent(self.context, self.agent_status) self.assertEqual(add_mock.call_count, 2, "Agent entry creation hasn't been retried")

commit_message:
Updates mysql to datastore in trove.instance

Reasons:
- Even though the support is on for multiple datastores, but still
  trove.instance contains few methods and messages with MYSQL hardcoded.

Changes:
- Updates hardcoded "mysql" to "datastore" in trove.instance.

Change-Id: I249766c2d5d19664193de90d19da15c9e20c6030
Closes-Bug: #1278740

commit_message:
remove duplicate ec2 request logging

because we are now using the logging handler directly in
eventlet.wsgi we current are logging twice for every ec2 request
in slightly different formats. We don't need our own log handler
on our wsgi stack, and should just use the eventlet one.

for upgrade reasons, we can't fully delete our request logger, as
it would require a paste change for the operator otherwise their
pipeline would blow up on a failed piece. So we deprecate and
stub out the request logging for Icehouse, and remove in Juno.

Implement bp: clean-logs

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ifffdab98f012df5cdf1be532d1000dc7484af821

commit_message:
VPNaaS Scenario Test

Implementation of basic scenario test for VPNaaS. Sets up two
sites, creates a VPN tunnel between them, boots a server in each
site and asserts that the servers cannot ping each other before
the tunnel is created and can ping each other after the tunnel is
created.

The status attributes of the relevant service resources are also
verified to be ACTIVE after the tunnel is created.

Partially Implements: blueprint add-scenario-tests-in-icehouse

Change-Id: I82a887a5afc1d1f20b29ea741aa8eb9ac0598252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/65515/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

import manager from tempest.test import services CONF = config.CONF # TODO(jroovers): proper comments class TestNetworkVPNaaS(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): @classmethod def check_preconditions(cls): super(TestNetworkVPNaaS, cls).check_preconditions() @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestNetworkVPNaaS, cls).setUpClass() cls.check_preconditions() cls.networks = [] cls.routers = [] cls.servers = [] def _setup_site(self, site_name, site_cidr): network_name_prefix = 'vpn-%s-net-' % site_name network = self._create_network(self.tenant_id, namestart=network_name_prefix) # TODO(jroovers): modify and use NetworkScenarioTest._create_subnet # so that we can pass a CIDR to it and subnet to it body = dict( subnet=dict( ip_version=4, network_id=network.id, tenant_id=network.tenant_id, cidr=site_cidr, ), ) subnet = self.network_client.create_subnet(body=body) subnet = subnet['subnet'] #TODO(jroovers) make sure subnet is properly cleaned up after test router_name_prefix = 'vpn-%s-router-' % site_name router = self._create_router(self.tenant_id, router_name_prefix) self.networks.append(network) # self.subnets.append(subnet) self.routers.append(router) body = {'subnet_id': subnet['id']} self.network_client.add_interface_router(router.id, body) self.addCleanup(self.network_client.remove_interface_router, router.id, body) body = {'network_id': CONF.network.public_network_id} self.network_client.add_gateway_router(router['id'], body) vpn_service_name = data_utils.rand_name('vpn-%s-net-' % site_name) body = { 'vpnservice': { 'subnet_id': subnet['id'], 'router_id': router['id'], 'name': vpn_service_name, 'admin_state_up': True } } vpnservice = self.network_client.create_vpnservice(body) vpnservice = vpnservice['vpnservice'] self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_vpnservice, vpnservice['id']) return network, subnet, router, vpnservice def _get_external_ip(self, router): ports = self.network_client.list_ports() ports = ports['ports'] relevant_port = [port for port in ports if port['device_owner'] == 'network:router_gateway' and port['device_id'] == router['id']][0] return relevant_port['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] def _create_ike_policy(self): ikepolicy_name = data_utils.rand_name('vpn-ike-') body = { 'ikepolicy': { 'name': ikepolicy_name, } } ikepolicy = self.network_client.create_ikepolicy(body) ikepolicy = ikepolicy['ikepolicy'] self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_ikepolicy, ikepolicy['id']) return ikepolicy def _create_ipsec_policy(self): ipsecpolicy_name = data_utils.rand_name('vpn-ipsecpolicy-') body = { 'ipsecpolicy': { 'name': ipsecpolicy_name } } ipsecpolicy = self.network_client.create_ipsecpolicy(body) ipsecpolicy = ipsecpolicy['ipsecpolicy'] self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_ipsecpolicy, ipsecpolicy['id']) return ipsecpolicy def _create_site_connection(self, vpnservice_id, ikepolicy_id, ipsecpolicy_id, peer_cidr, peer_address, psk): connection_name = data_utils.rand_name('vpn-ipsec_connection-east-') body = { 'ipsec_site_connection': { 'name': connection_name, 'vpnservice_id': vpnservice_id, 'ikepolicy_id': ikepolicy_id, 'ipsecpolicy_id': ipsecpolicy_id, 'peer_cidrs': [peer_cidr], 'peer_address': peer_address, 'peer_id': peer_address, 'psk': psk } } ipsec_site_connection = self.network_client \ .create_ipsec_site_connection(body) ipsec_site_connection = ipsec_site_connection['ipsec_site_connection'] self.addCleanup(self.network_client.delete_ipsec_site_connection, ipsec_site_connection['id']) return ipsec_site_connection def _create_server(self, name, network): create_kwargs = { 'nics': [ {'net-id': network['id']}, ], 'key_name': self.keypairs[network.tenant_id].name, 'tenant_id': network.tenant_id } server = self.create_server(name=name, create_kwargs=create_kwargs) self.servers.append(server) return server def _setup(self): # TODO(jroovers): read subnets from config file - also see comment in # _setup_site east_subnet = '192.168.3.0/24' west_subnet = '192.168.4.0/24' network_east, _, router_east, vpnservice_east = self._setup_site( 'east', east_subnet) _, _, router_west, vpnservice_west = self._setup_site('west', west_subnet) east_external_ip = self._get_external_ip(router_east) west_external_ip = self._get_external_ip(router_west) ikepolicy = self._create_ike_policy() ipsecpolicy = self._create_ipsec_policy() self._create_site_connection( vpnservice_id=vpnservice_east['id'], ikepolicy_id=ikepolicy['id'], ipsecpolicy_id=ipsecpolicy['id'], peer_cidr=west_subnet, peer_address=west_external_ip, psk='secret') self._create_site_connection( vpnservice_id=vpnservice_west['id'], ikepolicy_id=ikepolicy['id'], ipsecpolicy_id=ipsecpolicy['id'], peer_cidr=east_subnet, peer_address=east_external_ip, psk='secret') #east_server_name = data_utils.rand_name('vpn-server-east-') #self._create_server(name=east_server_name, network=network_east) def _run_checks(self): # TODO(jroovers): create a server on each site (east and west) # and try to ping from one server to the other # TODO(jroovers): verify that ipsec_site_connection status is ACTIVE pass @services('compute', 'network') def test_basic_vpnaas_scenario(self): self._setup() self._run_checks()

commit_message:
libvirt: alternative lxc init path

Existing default configuration for init command path is set to /sbin/init.
Users will be able to provided an alternative path, using the image properties,
to be used when starting a full os container and, as application path for a
generic application container.

glance image-update \
           --property lxc_init_path=/sbin/sh \
           [image]

DocImapct
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-lxc-application-containers
Change-Id: I0f9e9c233f077defba750a228d6f7da4a7ffcdcb

commit_message:
libvirt: Allow root directory as lxc source dir

Currently, only instance_dir/rootfs directory is being
set as the lxc source dir.
Users will be able to set the host root FS as the lxc
source dir, when launching an application directly from the
host, by setting the glance image property lxc_root_source_dir.

glance image-update \
       --property lxc_init_path=/sbin/sh \
       --property lxc_root_source_dir=true \
       [image]

DocImapct
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-lxc-application-containers

Change-Id: I8c2deb83d1f12d2526e01f8cf37975637771b551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/72624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
libvirt: don't mount an image if lxc source dir is provided

Currently, libvirt lxc driver is mounting an image to
an instance_dir/rootfs directory, is order to map it into the
container. However, there is no need to mount/umount the image,
in case of an application container case, when lxc_root_source_dir
is provided via the image properties.

DocImpact
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-lxc-application-containers
Change-Id: Ica44d2d499f1b5e5c5c89329b9f3a31bf00876d7

commit_message:
Adds sub-context support for logger

The change adds placeholder for sub-context information
for the logger. This will allow the consumers to add
custom contextual information for the logs

Change-Id: Ia69ca2276dfcfe02faa0f24dd78b419cdb532d35
Implements: blueprint enhanced-context-logger

added_lines: def test_sub_contextualized_log(self): ctxt = _fake_context() self.log.info("bar", context=ctxt, extra={"sub_context": {"driverid": "foo"}}) expected = "HAS CONTEXT [%s]: [driverid:foo] bar\n"\ % ctxt.request_id self.assertEqual(expected, self.stream.getvalue()) def test_empty_sub_contextualized_log(self): ctxt = _fake_context() self.log.info("bar", context=ctxt, extra={}) expected = "HAS CONTEXT [%s]: bar\n" % ctxt.request_id self.assertEqual(expected, self.stream.getvalue())

subject: Import and initialize oslo.messaging drivers for config options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 18:24:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools/commit/5d4afe0b86918c89f9559b8d4332f3b40baa60ee', 'message': "Import and initialize oslo.messaging drivers for config options

The config options for oslo.messaging drivers (rabbit_*, qpid_*, etc)
are not registered with oslo.config when any module is imported. You
have to instantiate an object of the appropriate driver for them to
be registered.

This means that modules that use oslo.messaging (glance, probably more
in the future) don't get those options listed in the docs. This commit
imports the drivers and instantiates them for known implementations,
in the least hacky way I can think of.

Change-Id: I931b2f39ab2b2c0de857b151865f1eaf77ba3162
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 18:58:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools/commit/339a75c7a07b3ab73dd7e91080191f9b60d3924e', 'message': "Import and initialize oslo.messaging drivers for config options

The config options for oslo.messaging drivers (rabbit_*, qpid_*, etc)
are not registered with oslo.config when any module is imported. You
have to instantiate an object of the appropriate driver for them to
be registered.

This means that modules that use oslo.messaging (glance, probably more
in the future) don't get those options listed in the docs. This commit
imports the drivers and instantiates them for known implementations,
in the least hacky way I can think of.

commit_message:
Import and initialize oslo.messaging drivers for config options

The config options for oslo.messaging drivers (rabbit_*, qpid_*, etc)
are not registered with oslo.config when any module is imported. You
have to instantiate an object of the appropriate driver for them to
be registered.

This means that modules that use oslo.messaging (glance, probably more
in the future) don't get those options listed in the docs. This commit
imports the drivers and instantiates them for known implementations,
in the least hacky way I can think of.

Change-Id: I931b2f39ab2b2c0de857b151865f1eaf77ba3162
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/96/68196/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def import_oslo_messaging_modules(verbose=0): """Import oslo.messaging modules. Imports the drivers modules for known oslo.messaging drivers and initializes the drivers to get their options registered with oslo.config. """ modules = {} if 'oslo.messaging' in sys.modules: import oslo.messaging from oslo.config import cfg for impl in ('rabbit', 'qpid', 'zmq'): modname = 'oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_' + impl modules[modname] = importlib.import_module(modname) print('imported %s' % modname) oslo.messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF, impl + '://') print('initialized oslo.messaging driver for %s' % impl) return modules

commit_message:
Update policy check for flavor related API

update policy check for v3 API, move from extension to core on flavor
manage. Also, add action policy check instead of check on flavor.
Remove policy check in db layer because the api layer already check
it in the policy check routine.

Added several test cases to do policy test for v2 and v3 flavor.

Change-Id: Ida904ff88cd2685986ab5559e89226b53aca59db
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

commit_message:
Update policy check on each action for agents

v3 api requested policy check on each action instead of the whole
topic, this patch update the check in agents and added some test
cases for policy check on agents.
Also, removed db layer admin policy check because it's already be
done at API layer.

Change-Id: Icc58211170160200cdb92a69f268ab0d07043ea1
Implements: blueprint v3-api-policy

added_lines: from nova.openstack.common import policy as common_policy def test_agents_create_with_policy_failed(self): req = FakeRequest() body = {'agent': {'hypervisor': 'kvm', 'os': 'win', 'architecture': 'x86', 'version': '7.0', 'url': 'xxx://xxxx/xxx/xxx', 'md5hash': 'add6bb58e139be103324d04d82d8f545'}} rules = { "compute_extension:v3:os-agents:create": common_policy.parse_rule("!") } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) self.assertRaises(exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.create, req, body=body) def test_agents_delete_with_policy_failed(self): req = FakeRequest() rules = { "compute_extension:v3:os-agents:delete": common_policy.parse_rule("!") } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) self.assertRaises(exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.delete, req, 1) def test_agents_list_with_policy_failed(self): req = FakeRequest() rules = { "compute_extension:v3:os-agents:index": common_policy.parse_rule("!") } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) self.assertRaises(exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.index, req) def test_agents_update_with_policy_failed(self): req = FakeRequest() body = {'agent': {'version': '7.0', 'url': 'xxx://xxxx/xxx/xxx', 'md5hash': 'add6bb58e139be103324d04d82d8f545'}} rules = { "compute_extension:v3:os-agents:update": common_policy.parse_rule("!") } common_policy.set_rules(common_policy.Rules(rules)) self.assertRaises(exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.update, req, 1, body=body)

commit_message:
Version discovery for KDS

Add a definition for version discovery to the KDS API. There is no
correct way of implementing this within current OpenStack so this
implementation is a minimal selection of what seems to be the current
best practices.

Change-Id: I5503c28b93bd503d857a7da118d1fe2329ac0efe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/92/72192/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #### List available KDS versions: `GET /` Discover the KDS API versions that are supported by this server. ##### Response The response contains a list of version objects. A version object must contain at least: - `id` - A string identifier of the version number. - `status` - The status of this version of the API. This will be `CURRENT` for a stable API version. - `links` - A list of links associated with this version. A link object must contain: - `rel` - The relationship of the link with the version. - `href` - The URL for this link. Each version response must contain at least one link with a `rel` of `self` which indicates the link from which the API can be accessed. Status: 300 Multiple Choices { "versions": [{ "status": "CURRENT", "id": "v1.0", "links": [{ "href": "http://localhost:9109/v1/", "rel": "self" }], }] } #### Show Version 1 Information: `GET /v1/` Retrieve details about this specific version of the API. ##### Response Contains one entry of a version object. For details on the structure of a version object see the List available versions section. Status: 200 OK { "version": { "status": "CURRENT", "id": "v1.0", "links": [{ "href": "http://localhost:9109/v1/", "rel": "self" }], } }

commit_message:
Expose ML2 mechanism driver exceptions to the user

Previously, whenever a ML2 mechanism driver raised an exception, ie
in a precommit or postcommit method, that exception would be hidden
from the user because the _call_on_driver() method in managers.py
raises a generic MechanismDriverError exception.

This change is to change the message text of the MechanismDriverError
exception to also include the text from the last exception encountered
from the mechanism drivers.

Change-Id: Ib715f3d1303aebfb6d5c3f3f0580e8e8f004331b
Closes-Bug: #1273730

commit_message:
Use assertEqual replace assertEquals for the unit test

assertEquals is deprecated, use assertEqual replace it.

Change-Id: Ibd438dce865f25c8f67e7d5b0c6edbe2ea3c5de6

commit_message:
Use class attribute to represent 'project'

When sending a notification a resource_type is required, such as a
'project'. This value is consistent between the notification.created,
updated, delete, disabled methods in the Manager class, so use a class
attribute to represent it.

Change-Id: I65cc0ffb1d8811ae9f518492f998e426005345f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/65/74265/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _PROJECT = 'project' @notifications.created(_PROJECT) @notifications.disabled(_PROJECT, public=False) @notifications.updated(_PROJECT) @notifications.deleted(_PROJECT)

commit_message:
Update hp3parclient low version number

This is the 2nd patch that upgrades the hp3parclient
to requiring the new 3.0.0 version for unit tests.

commit_message:
raw_template hot parameter type data migration

Changes were made to the hot syntax which prevent invalid templates
already present in the database from being loaded as part of a stack
list. This database migration forces the parameter schema type to
be lowercase.

Change-Id: Iaa4b16e9b5188e6e99cda95e1c7fb0dc11c206f7
Partial-Bug: #1274288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/50/70050/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker from migrate.versioning import util as migrate_util from heat.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from heat.db.sqlalchemy import models from heat.engine.hot import HOTParamSchema def upgrade(migrate_engine): Session = sessionmaker(bind=migrate_engine) session = Session() raw_templates = session.query(models.RawTemplate).all() for raw_template in raw_templates: if ('heat_template_version' in raw_template.template and 'parameters' in raw_template.template): template = raw_template.template for parameter, schema in template['parameters'].iteritems(): if 'type' in schema: if (schema['type'] not in HOTParamSchema.TYPES and schema['type'].istitle()): schema['type'] = schema['type'].lower() template['parameters'][parameter] = schema raw_template.template = template session.commit() def downgrade(migrate_engine): migrate_util.log.warning(_('This version cannot be downgraded because ' 'it involves a data migration to the ' 'raw_template table.'))

commit_message:
Sync jsonutils.py and timeutils.py from oslo

cinderclient should be refactored like keystoneclient,
this two files should be imported from oslo first.

keystoneclient/access.py will be imported to cinderclient,
that file use timeutils, while its unit test use jsonutils

partly Closes-Bug: #1263876
blueprint service-catalog

Change-Id: Ie42714b3637dcd4c97570636d84e674bd5bd1f13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/26/74226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2010 United States Government as represented by the # Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. # Copyright 2011 Justin Santa Barbara # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. ''' JSON related utilities. This module provides a few things: 1) A handy function for getting an object down to something that can be JSON serialized. See to_primitive(). 2) Wrappers around loads() and dumps(). The dumps() wrapper will automatically use to_primitive() for you if needed. 3) This sets up anyjson to use the loads() and dumps() wrappers if anyjson is available. ''' import datetime import functools import inspect import itertools import json try: import xmlrpclib except ImportError: # NOTE(jaypipes): xmlrpclib was renamed to xmlrpc.client in Python3 # however the function and object call signatures # remained the same. This whole try/except block should # be removed and replaced with a call to six.moves once # six 1.4.2 is released. See http://bit.ly/1bqrVzu import xmlrpc.client as xmlrpclib import six from cinderclient.openstack.common import gettextutils from cinderclient.openstack.common import importutils from cinderclient.openstack.common import timeutils netaddr = importutils.try_import("netaddr") _nasty_type_tests = [inspect.ismodule, inspect.isclass, inspect.ismethod, inspect.isfunction, inspect.isgeneratorfunction, inspect.isgenerator, inspect.istraceback, inspect.isframe, inspect.iscode, inspect.isbuiltin, inspect.isroutine, inspect.isabstract] _simple_types = (six.string_types + six.integer_types + (type(None), bool, float)) def to_primitive(value, convert_instances=False, convert_datetime=True, level=0, max_depth=3): """Convert a complex object into primitives. Handy for JSON serialization. We can optionally handle instances, but since this is a recursive function, we could have cyclical data structures. To handle cyclical data structures we could track the actual objects visited in a set, but not all objects are hashable. Instead we just track the depth of the object inspections and don't go too deep. Therefore, convert_instances=True is lossy ... be aware. """ # handle obvious types first - order of basic types determined by running # full tests on nova project, resulting in the following counts: # 572754 <type 'NoneType'> # 460353 <type 'int'> # 379632 <type 'unicode'> # 274610 <type 'str'> # 199918 <type 'dict'> # 114200 <type 'datetime.datetime'> # 51817 <type 'bool'> # 26164 <type 'list'> # 6491 <type 'float'> # 283 <type 'tuple'> # 19 <type 'long'> if isinstance(value, _simple_types): return value if isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): if convert_datetime: return timeutils.strtime(value) else: return value # value of itertools.count doesn't get caught by nasty_type_tests # and results in infinite loop when list(value) is called. if type(value) == itertools.count: return six.text_type(value) # FIXME(vish): Workaround for LP bug 852095. Without this workaround, # tests that raise an exception in a mocked method that # has a @wrap_exception with a notifier will fail. If # we up the dependency to 0.5.4 (when it is released) we # can remove this workaround. if getattr(value, '__module__', None) == 'mox': return 'mock' if level > max_depth: return '?' # The try block may not be necessary after the class check above, # but just in case ... try: recursive = functools.partial(to_primitive, convert_instances=convert_instances, convert_datetime=convert_datetime, level=level, max_depth=max_depth) if isinstance(value, dict): return dict((k, recursive(v)) for k, v in six.iteritems(value)) elif isinstance(value, (list, tuple)): return [recursive(lv) for lv in value] # It's not clear why xmlrpclib created their own DateTime type, but # for our purposes, make it a datetime type which is explicitly # handled if isinstance(value, xmlrpclib.DateTime): value = datetime.datetime(*tuple(value.timetuple())[:6]) if convert_datetime and isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): return timeutils.strtime(value) elif isinstance(value, gettextutils.Message): return value.data elif hasattr(value, 'iteritems'): return recursive(dict(value.iteritems()), level=level + 1) elif hasattr(value, '__iter__'): return recursive(list(value)) elif convert_instances and hasattr(value, '__dict__'): # Likely an instance of something. Watch for cycles. # Ignore class member vars. return recursive(value.__dict__, level=level + 1) elif netaddr and isinstance(value, netaddr.IPAddress): return six.text_type(value) else: if any(test(value) for test in _nasty_type_tests): return six.text_type(value) return value except TypeError: # Class objects are tricky since they may define something like # __iter__ defined but it isn't callable as list(). return six.text_type(value) def dumps(value, default=to_primitive, **kwargs): return json.dumps(value, default=default, **kwargs) def loads(s): return json.loads(s) def load(s): return json.load(s) try: import anyjson except ImportError: pass else: anyjson._modules.append((__name__, 'dumps', TypeError, 'loads', ValueError, 'load')) anyjson.force_implementation(__name__)

commit_message:
Adding initial support for DevStack

Change-Id: I8ad6268766752ea2db09b4f4ed5f47cc98899294

Change-Id: I1de5338bff20be07db7f576bf51e5ddf1a251de7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/97/74597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh # barbican.sh - DevStack extras script to install Barbican if is_service_enabled barbican; then if [[ "$1" == "source" ]]; then # Initial source source $TOP_DIR/lib/barbican elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "install" ]]; then echo_summary "Installing Barbican" install_barbicanclient install_barbican elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "post-config" ]]; then echo_summary "Configuring Barbican" configure_barbican configure_barbicanclient if is_service_enabled key; then create_barbican_accounts fi elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "extra" ]]; then echo_summary "Initializing Barbican" init_barbican start_barbican fi if [[ "$1" == "unstack" ]]; then stop_barbican fi fi

commit_message:
Implements complex query functionality for alarm history

New API resource /query/alarms/history has been added.

Implements: blueprint complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries
Change-Id: I8a98b4edc2dc7afac9261bc0cd83f69d7cadc4b9

added_lines: def query_alarms_history(self, filter_=[], orderby=[], limit=None): """Return an iterable of model.AlarmChange objects. """ if limit == 0: return session = sqlalchemy_session.get_session() query = session.query(models.AlarmChange) if filter_: sql_condition = self._transform_to_sqlalchemy(filter_, models.AlarmChange) query = query.filter(sql_condition) query = self._apply_order_by(query, orderby, models.AlarmChange) if limit: query = query.limit(limit) return (self._row_to_alarm_change_model(x) for x in query.all())
